intro: Elatostema androstachyum, commonly known as the slender false shamrock, is a herbaceous plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle species, and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understoreys. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Elatostema androstachyum is often found in rocky or clay soils and is well adapted to the humid conditions of its native habitat.
